alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:15PM EST until December 19 at 11:48PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River above Dover-Foxcroft. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, In Dover-Foxcroft, flood waters reach South Street at the intersection of Pine and Lawrence Streets. In Guilford, water reaches lower portions of Main Street and Water Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 9.7 feet. - At 9.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 09/29/1909. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
